overwrite.h: Implicitly overwrites exported documentation file if it exists already.

json.h: Selected metadata is returned as json dictionary

keys.h: Return only keys from metadata dictionary

values.h: Return only values from metadata dictionary

metadata.in: KEY can be provided to get only selected key(s) from metadata dictionary. If KEY is not provided then all keys from metadata dictionary are selected.

only.h: Print only arguments Cheat Sheet syntax and exit.

syntax.h: Print arguments Cheat Sheet syntax and exit.

_query_.h: Load program's arguments from a json file with optional parameterized values.
_query_.in: query argument allows to execute safe command-line arguments query on the program. Command-line arguments are collected through a JSON file. The JSON file has two attributes 'command' and 'params'. 'command' accepts a list of command-line arguments with values where each value may be replaced with a question mark. 'params' accepts a list of values. The number of values in 'params' must match the number of question marks in 'command'. 'command' arguments are only parsed as arguments and 'params' are only parsed as argument values. It allows a safe way to pass values collected from a third party program like a web application to the command-line program. All errors are returned as a json dump for better communication with third party program.(see Nargs developer documentation)

depth.h: Provide the printing depth of nested arguments.
depth.in: If LEVEL == -1 then all nested arguments are printed. If LEVEL == 0 then only selected argument is printed. If LEVEL > 0 then the bigger the LEVEL number is, the bigger the children nesting level is if any children are available.

flags.h: Print flag set if any for all arguments available on the terminal.

from.h: This option allows to start printing usage from a parent.
from.in: If LEVEL == -1 then selected argument is the root argument. If LEVEL == 0 then selected argument is the current argument. If LEVEL > 0 then one argument parent is selected and the bigger the LEVEL number is, the older the selected parent is unless parent's limit is reached. Argument's parent's limit is the oldest parent also called the root argument.

_usage_.in: LEVEL is an integer >= 0. LEVEL number describes the number of nested node levels to print. LEVEL number is relative to current argument node level. If LEVEL == 0 then all nested node levels are printed. If LEVEL == 1 then only current argument is printed. If LEVEL > 1 current argument's node levels are printed and LEVEL sets the depth of node levels nesting.

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

generate_db.in: list all folders in repository and generate the db.json.

filenpa_conf.in: package JSON config file path. It can be relative or absolute.

filter_rules.in: gitignore like rules to filter source path

keys.in: If keys is present, the imported package is considered a template and its files are going to be copied first in a tmp directory. Then the files are going to be scanned for {{placeholders}}. If keys json values are provided then they are going to autofill the related {{placeholders}} else for each found values not provided the user is going to be prompted to enter the value. regex syntax for placeholders {{([a-zA-Z0-9-_ ]+?)}}

no_conf_dst.in: Do not import the conf file with the imported package

no_conf_src.in: Allow to process the command without having a configuration file.

no_root_dir.in: Package content is copied without the package alias root directory.

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

package_filters.in: Package filters are comma separated string. The fields are bound, alias, version, uuid4. Fields order does not matter and not all fields need to be present

path_deps.in: Select directory destination path for dependencies (can be relative or absolute). If path is omitted, --path-pkg or current directory is selected.

path_pkg.in: Select directory package path (can be relative or absolute).

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

import_pkgs.in: import packages in a git project with a folder gpkgs.

package_filters.in: Package filters are comma separated string. The fields are bound, alias, version, uuid4. Fields order does not matter and not all fields need to be present

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

ls_rel.in: List all packages in the release repository. You can add alias(es) to filter by aliases.

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

rel_strip.in: Remove all versions of a package except the latest. Select specific packages or no packages to run the function on all packages

filenpa_conf.in: package JSON config file path. It can be relative or absolute.

no_conf_src.in: Allow to process the command without having a configuration file.

no_root_dir.in: Package content is copied without the package alias root directory.

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

path_pkg.in: Select directory package path (can be relative or absolute).

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

filenpa_conf.in: package JSON config file path. It can be relative or absolute.

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

path_deps.in: Select directory destination path for dependencies (can be relative or absolute). If path is omitted, --path-pkg or current directory is selected.

path_pkg.in: Select directory package path (can be relative or absolute).

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

filen_main.in: Package main file if any, just the full name

filenpa_conf.in: package JSON config file path. It can be relative or absolute.

pkg_alias.in: package alias, or package name if alias has not been set.

pkg_name.in: package alias, or package name if alias has not been set.

set_conf.in: create a config file for a new project.

set_launcher.in: Generate launch.pyw for windows for quick project opening.

path_bin.in: Select Bin Path (can be relative or absolute).

pkg_alias.in: package alias, or package name if alias has not been set.

switch_bin.in: Given an application alias and a version, then current executable in the path is switched to that version. For pkg_version choose 'latest' to get the latest version available from bin. You can also choose 'beta' if available

pkg_alias.in: package alias, or package name if alias has not been set.

from_bin.in: Transfer package from default binaries repository or from selected binaries repository

conf_from_rel.in: package configuration can be retrieved from a release repository

filenpa_conf.in: package JSON config file path. It can be relative or absolute.

no_conf.in: Allow to process the command without having a configuration file.

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

from_pkg.in: Transfer package from current directory or from selected directory. If --version is specified then package is considered a git package.

from_rel.in: Transfer package from default releases repository or from selected releases repository

from_src.in: Transfer package from default sources repository or from selected sources repository

pkg_alias.in: package alias, or package name if alias has not been set.

from_wrk.in: Transfer package from default work repository or from selected work repository

only_paths.in: Select directories or files that are going to be selected for the package

package_filters.in: Package filters are comma separated string. The fields are bound, alias, version, uuid4. Fields order does not matter and not all fields need to be present

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

beta.in: Add this flag to send the current state to bin as beta.

filen_main.in: Package main file if any, just the full name

no_symlink.in: When pushing a bin pkg to an sshfs mount bin from another system, like from linux to windows then use no symlink and use mlink on windows computer to restore the symlink.

to_bin.in: Transfer package to default binaries repository or to selected binaries repository

to_pkg.in: Transfer package to current directory or to selected directory.

to_rel.in: Transfer package to default releases repository or to selected releases repository

to_src.in: Transfer package to default sources repository or to selected sources repository

to_wrk.in: Transfer package to default work repository or to selected work repository

transfer.in: Package is selected from one location and transfered to another. If the 'from location type' and the 'to location type' does not match then package is converted at destination type if supported.

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

path_deps.in: Select directory destination path for dependencies (can be relative or absolute). If path is omitted, --path-pkg or current directory is selected.

path_pkg.in: Select directory package path (can be relative or absolute).

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

not_git.in: Allow working with packages that does not have a .git folder

path_deps.in: Select directory destination path for dependencies (can be relative or absolute). If path is omitted, --path-pkg or current directory is selected.

path_pkg.in: Select directory package path (can be relative or absolute).

path_rel.in: Select Repository Path (can be relative or absolute).

ex:
release --generate-db --path-rel /tmp/test
release --import -p message
release --ls -p message
release --rel-strip mockpkg
release --transfer --from-pkg --to-rel
release --remove -p message
release --restore
release --set-conf
release --set-launcher
release --switch-bin --alias bump_version --version 1.1.1
release --update message
release --upgrade message
release --transfer --from-rel --to-bin ~/mnt/bin --pkgs guidelines --no-symlink
release --transfer --from-rel --to-rel ~/mnt/rel --pkgs guidelines

metadata.description: This is a small package manager that is developped on the side for my current needs until I finish coding the 'Generic Package Manager'
metadata.name: release
